title: 22-year-old Indian origin student Saketh Sreenivasaiah found dead in US, was missing for 4 days
content: A 22-year-old Indian student, Saketh Sreenivasaiah, pursuing a Master's at UC Berkeley, has been found deceased. Reported missing on February 12th, his body was recovered by local police, confirmed by the Consulate General of India, San Francisco. Consular officers are providing full support to his family, including arrangements for repatriation.

title: Bangladesh polls: BNP wants PM Modi, Saarc leaders at Tarique Rahman's oath ceremony
content: PM Modi will be invited to the swearing-in ceremony of the new govt in Bangladesh led by BNP chief Tarique Rahman, who wants to engage constructively with India. Senior BNP functionaries indicated that Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif and other heads of govt of Saarc countries will also be invited.

title: Noida: Ex-Lovers found dead in locked car, gun recovered; last whatsapp message hints at fallout
content: A man and woman were found dead from gunshot wounds inside a locked car in Noida, with police investigating a murder-suicide. A message on the man's phone suggests he killed his ex-girlfriend before taking his own life. Both families had filed missing person reports prior to the discovery.

title: Anthropic CEO tells US govt 'not to do' what Nvidia CEO has been 'begging' for
content: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei strongly opposes selling advanced AI chips to China, viewing them as a national security risk. He argues that while AI's economic benefits should be shared globally, critical compute power must remain out of authoritarian hands. Amodei believes this approach is crucial for maintaining global stability and preventing misuse of AI technology.

title: Sahibzada vs Bumrah, Babar vs Kuldeep: Battles that could decide India vs Pakistan clash
content: The last time they faced each other in a T20I, Sahibzada Farhan hit Jasprit Bumrah for two sixes in a single game, becoming one of the few international batters to do so. Farhan later featured in an advertorial documentary about those shots in Dubai.

title: How Epstein secured visas, sham marriages for women in his trafficking network
content: Newly released US Department of Justice files reveal Jeffrey Epstein exploited student visas, English schools, and marriages to manage women's immigration status. He sponsored language programs and pursued work visas, even arranging a marriage for one woman to secure permanent residency and citizenship.

title: After CEO asked employees to stop coding, Nvidia engineers get access to OpenAI's Codex
content: Nvidia has deployed OpenAI's Codex AI coding tool to all 30,000 engineers, marking a significant enterprise rollout. CEO Jensen Huang's mandate to automate tasks with AI is driving this adoption, with engineers praising the tool's ability to handle complex workflows and maintain context.

title: 'Out of syllabus question': Suryakumar Yadav on Pakistan spinner Usman Tariq
content: India skipper Suryakumar Yadav acknowledged the team's batting struggles in the T20 World Cup but expressed confidence in tackling Pakistan's unique spinner, Usman Tariq. Despite a scratchy start and vulnerabilities exposed in earlier matches, Yadav emphasized the team's ability to adapt and execute their practice, aiming to overcome pressure and deliver a strong performance against Pakistan.

title: Maha Shivratri 2026: Best messages, quotes and images to share
content: Maha Shivratri, celebrated on February 15, is a highly auspicious Hindu festival marking Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati's marriage. Devotees observe fasts, perform Rudra Abhishek, and offer prayers to Lord Shiva, believing wishes are granted and past karmas are cleansed. The article provides numerous greetings and messages to share, wishing for divine grace, peace, and prosperity.

title: Cisco president Jeetu Patel says company will never hire these developers
content: Cisco's president Jeetu Patel mandates AI for all developers, aiming for half a dozen AI-coded products by 2026. This shift to spec-driven development sees human teams shrink, with AI agents tripling output. While embracing AI's potential, Cisco is investing heavily in security to prevent rogue agents, urging developers to master AI to stay relevant.

title: With no dowry case in a decade, Bihar‚Äôs Tharu community rewrites social norms
content: In the vibrant Tharu villages near Gobarhiya police station, a remarkable shift has taken place‚Äîdowry practices have been dismantled thanks to a community-driven cultural renaissance. Driven by the belief that true marriage transcends monetary exchanges, local leaders champion a return to traditional values, deeming dowry as an affront to their heritage.

title: Chhattisgarh horror: Out on bail, rape accused kills survivor, later dies by suicide
content: In a deeply troubling turn of events in Balod district, a 57-year-old man, recently released on bail for rape charges, has been implicated in the tragic murder of a 54-year-old anganwadi worker at her office. Eyewitnesses report that Lakhan Dewangan barricaded himself with the victim before the appalling act. Following the incident, he reportedly took his own life.

title: Team Canada rules out Brad Marchand, Josh Morrissey vs Switzerland
content: Team Canada faces Switzerland at the 2026 Winter Olympics without key players Josh Morrissey and Brad Marchand. Morrissey is sidelined with an undisclosed injury sustained against Czechia, while Marchand's absence remains unexplained. Seth Jarvis is set to make his Olympic debut, replacing Morrissey on the third line, with Travis Sanheim also stepping into the lineup.

title: Kylie Young grabs attention at WM Phoenix Open in summer frock
content: Jack Bech‚Äôs girlfriend Kylie Young used the WM Phoenix Open to quietly own the offseason, sharing sundress and golf-day looks that stood out while the Las Vegas Raiders regroup from a 3-14 year. From Phoenix to Aspen and Raiders game days, her Instagram keeps building a separate highlight reel around the rookie wide receiver.

title: Candace Owens calls claims about Erika Kirk 'absolutely vile'
content: A viral post has intensified debate over Candace Owens‚Äô use of the term grooming in reference to a 15 year old. Critic Natly Denise accused Owens of exaggerating the situation, while Owens cited details from her own interview describing limited in person contact and online messages. The clash highlights ongoing tensions over how serious terms are defined and used in public commentary.

title: ‚ÄòHalf-burnt body stuffed in suitcase‚Äô: Man kills woman, then gets her tattooed on his chest in Punjab
content: Bathinda Police have arrested Prince Kumar for the murder of his friend, Sapna, also known as Malika. Kumar confessed to killing Malika over a dispute on February 9th and subsequently attempting to dispose of her half-burnt body. The victim's remains were discovered stuffed in a suitcase in fields near Behman Diwana village.

title: 'Move on' ‚Äì How BCCI nudged Dhoni to quit captaincy and hand over to Kohli
content: The BCCI selection committee initiated the captaincy change from MS Dhoni to Virat Kohli in 2017.  Former selector Jatin Paranjpe revealed Dhoni accepted the decision respectfully.  Dhoni assured full support to Kohli, offering his experience.  This transition occurred after Dhoni had already achieved significant white-ball success for India.

title: Darron Lee murder case shifts as family files $50M lawsuit
content: While Daron Lee's girlfriend, Gabriella Carvalho Perp√©tuo's brutal death has sparked shockwaves across the league, the former Kansas City Chiefs player is now facing a first degree murder charge for the alleged killing and tampering evidence at the site. Amid all the mess, the case has taken a new turn as Gabriella Carvalho Perp√©tuo's family filed a new lawsuit against him.

title: Police probe extortion threat: Himanshi Khurana files FIR over Rs 10cr demand
content: Himanshi Khurana, known for her stint on Bigg Boss 13, has taken serious action by filing a complaint with the police in Mohali following an unsettling experience. She received an email containing an extortion threat of Rs 10 crore from a foreign criminal, prompting her to seek justice.

title: Edmonton Oilers worry as Leon Draisaitl aggravates hand injury
content: Edmonton Oilers' star Leon Draisaitl is raising concerns as he's repeatedly seen icing his right hand during Germany's Olympic Games. The injury, possibly aggravated by the tournament, stems from a January incident. Despite visible discomfort, Draisaitl continues to perform, but his health is a major worry for the Oilers' playoff push.

title: 'Not shown commitment': Nepal coach reprimands team after loss against Italy
content: Nepal had earlier pushed two-time champions England in a high-scoring match but failed to carry that performance forward. Against tournament debutants Italy, they were beaten without taking a wicket.

title: PM Modi invitation likely? BNP leader cites 'friends to all' ahead of Rahman's swearing-in
content: Bangladesh Nationalist Party leader ANM Ehsanul Hoque Milan suggested inviting Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to the swearing-in ceremony of BNP chief Tarique Rahman, who is set to become the next Prime Minister. The BNP secured a landslide victory in the general elections, marking their return to power after nearly two decades.

title: 'Got India's commitment to stop buying Russian oil,' claims Rubio at Munich conference
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio claimed India committed to halting additional Russian oil purchases, amidst ongoing US sanctions. However, India's External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar emphasized "strategic autonomy" and decisions guided by "national interest" and market dynamics. Russia's Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov disputed claims of India stopping oil buys, accusing the US of coercion.

title: 'You‚Äôll see me play in a World Cup‚Äô: Abhishek‚Äôs promise to father comes full circle
content: After a health scare threatened to derail his World Cup campaign, Abhishek Sharma returns to the spotlight in Colombo. It will be the first time his father Raj Kumar Sharma watches him play a World Cup match from the stands. India will take on Pakistan on February 15 at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

title: Happy Maha Shivratri 2026: Top 50 wishes, messages, and quotes
content: Maha Shivratri offers a unique, quiet devotion, symbolizing faith, strength, and surrender. Millions observe this night of prayer and reflection, with many fasting and offering prayers to Lord Shiva. The festival provides a much-needed pause in busy lives, reminding devotees of inner peace and the enduring power of faith, offering comfort and hope.

title: Markram's captain's knock powers SA to comfortable 7-wicket win over NZ
content: Aiden Markram's explosive 86 powered South Africa to a seven-wicket victory over New Zealand, bringing them closer to the Super 8s. Markram's dominant chase, supported by quick starts and a solid finish from David Miller, saw South Africa comfortably reach their target of 176. This win marks their third consecutive victory in the T20 World Cup.

title: Trump would agree to meeting with Iran's Khamenei, says Rubio
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio indicated President Trump would meet Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei if the opportunity arose, signaling a willingness for dialogue. Rubio emphasized Trump's preference for resolving conflicts through negotiation, while also asserting Iran will not be allowed to possess nuclear weapons.

title: Russia killed opposition leader Navalny using dart frog toxin, 5 European nations say
content: Five European nations confirmed Alexei Navalny was poisoned with a lethal toxin, accusing the Russian state. Laboratory analysis detected epibatidine, a powerful poison not naturally found in Russia. The countries will report Moscow to the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons for an alleged breach of the Chemical Weapons Convention.

title: 'Eat well and go to sleep': Surya, Agha sidestep handshake chatter pre India-Pakistan WC clash
content: Captains Suryakumar Yadav and Salman Ali Agha remained non-committal on whether India and Pakistan players would shake hands before or after their T20 World Cup clash. Both leaders suggested waiting until match day for a decision, emphasizing their focus on playing good cricket. This follows a history where India did not shake hands with Pakistan in previous encounters.

title: Silver considering all fixes for NBA's tanking issue
content: NBA commissioner Adam Silver called tanking the worst it has been in "recent memory" and said he's not ruling out any potential remedy, including taking away draft picks, to stop overt tanking.

title: Dame claims 3rd title; Johnson wins dunk contest
content: Damian Lillard, nine months after undergoing surgery on his torn Achilles, won his third All-Star 3-point contest to tie with Larry Bird and Craig Hodges for the most ever.

title: Eichel, Tkachuk rally unbeaten U.S. past Denmark
content: The U.S. men's Olympic hockey team rode its top line to a 6-3 win over Denmark and remain tied with also-unbeaten Canada going into the final day of the preliminary round.

title: UConn, UCLA top projected women's top 16 seeds
content: UConn, UCLA, South Carolina and Vanderbilt are the projected No. 1 seeds in the women's NCAA tournament, it was announced Saturday.

title: Six players ejected in St. John's-Providence clash
content: Six players were ejected from Saturday's Big East clash between No. 17 St. John's and Providence after a hard foul by Friars forward Duncan Powell on Red Storm star Bryce Hopkins.

title: Sources: Raiders promoting Leonard to DC
content: The Raiders are promoting run game coordinator/defensive line coach Rob Leonard to defensive coordinator, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Silver won't set deadline for WNBA agreement
content: NBA commissioner Adam Silver said he is not prepared to set a deadline for a new agreement to ensure the WNBA season would start on the scheduled May 8 opening night.

content: Which teams will make a splash move? Which teams must make adjustments? We answered big offseason questions.

content: Saturday at the Winter Olympics includes Team USA men's hockey winning against Denmark and USA curling round-robins.

content: Impress your friends by repeating ESPN's easy-to-learn fun facts about the Great American Race ahead of this year's edition of the Daytona 500.

content: Mohamed Salah turning in a memorable performance in front of an adoring Anfield crowd? No, it's not 2024, but it sure felt like it on Saturday night in Liverpool.

content: The Last Four In and First Four Out groupings feature teams with big wins -- and high potential for March.

title: Women's Bracketology: There's a new No. 1 seed
content: For the first time this season, there's a shake-up on the top line. Vanderbilt beat Texas to unseat the Longhorns.

title: Who's really fastest in 2026? F1's new rules are confusing the pecking order -- and the drivers
content: Formula 1's new era was always going to bring questions, but its first week of serious running has raised more than most. With one more preseason test in Bahrain still to come, ESPN makes sense of a fascinating three days in Sakhir.

title: Win projections for all 30 MLB teams -- and how the offseason changed expectations
content: Fans love a big splash but don't always get one. Here's what some non-moves mean for each team's playoff forecast.

content: Joe Judge was trying to make a point to help a player get a court injunction. Instead he got a viral moment.

content: The French team's victory in ice dance at the Winter Olympics has drawn criticism for a number of reasons. We break it down.

content: Everything you need to know about the 2026 season for the fan who has been away and is looking to dive back in.

title: Fantasy draft guide: Rankings, tips, strategy, stats and more
content: All the rankings, projections, cheat sheets, strategy and analysis you need for the 2026 fantasy baseball season.

title: Stones' quest for World Cup, new Man City deal begins with win over Salford
content: John Stones returned from a three-month injury layoff on Saturday, the first step toward earning a World Cup place and a new Man City contract.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Madrid squash Arsenal, Chelsea Endrick hopes
content: Endrick had to leave Madrid in search of minutes, but now that he's succeeding on loan at Lyon, Real want him back. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: How BharatGen Is Building India's Sovereign AI Future
content: As artificial intelligence redraws the global balance of power, India has quietly but decisively entered the foundational layer of this transformation.

title: PM Modi Receives Invite For Tarique Rahman's Oath Ceremony On February 17
content: Dhaka is set to witness a major political moment on February 17 as Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) Chairman Tarique Rahman is sworn in as the next Prime Minister of Bangladesh, marking the formal return of the BNP to power.

title: 'Bangladesh First': Tarique Rahman's Reply To Query On Ties With India
content: After a sweeping victory in the 13th National Parliamentary Elections, Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) chief Tarique Rahman, in a press conference, said that Bangladesh's foreign policy will prioritise the country's interests over others.

title: ICE Continues Illegal Detentions Despite 4,400 Court Rulings Against Them
content: Hundreds of judges around the country have ruled more than 4,400 times since October that President Donald Trump's administration is detaining immigrants unlawfully, a Reuters review of court records found.

title: "They Have Faith In You": Crown Prince Calls On Trump To Help Iranians
content: The exiled son of Iran's last shah called on US President Donald Trump on Saturday to help the Iranian people, a day after the American leader said a change of power would be the "best thing".

title: Ex Bigg Boss Contestant Himanshi Khurana Gets Rs 10 Crore Extortion Threat
content: Punjabi actress Himanshi Khurana lodged a complaint with the Mohali police, claiming that she received an extortion threat of Rs 10 crore from a foreign based gangster, officials said.

title: US Army Conducts 10 Strikes On 30 Islamic State Targets In Syria In 2 Weeks
content: The US military said that it had struck more than 30 Islamic State group targets in Syria over the last two weeks as a response to an attack on US troops last year which killed two US soldiers and one American civilian interpreter.

title: "India Very Much Wedded To Strategic Autonomy": S Jaishankar
content: India is very much wedded to its policy of "strategic autonomy" and the country's energy procurement will be driven by factors like costs, risks and availability, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said.

title: S Jaishankar Reiterates India's Support For UNSC Reform In Munich Conference
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Saturday met his counterparts from the G7 countries as he reiterated India's support for reform of the UN Security Council (UNSC) at the Munich Security Conference.

title: Trump Open To Talks With Ayatollah Khamenei, Says US Amid Tensions With Iran
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Trump's preference was for a deal with Iran and also left the door open to Trump meeting Iran's supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei.

title: Madhya Pradesh's Tiger Crisis Deepens As Poachers Jailed, Death Count Soars
content: In a dramatic week that has shaken India's tiger capital, three key operatives of an international tiger poaching and smuggling syndicate have been sentenced to four years in prison

title: Forest Official Attacked By Mafia, Cops File FIR Nearly 24 Hours Later
content: In eastern Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district, the coal mafia has once again shown who really calls the shots.

title: How Epstein Used Sham Marriages, Student Visas To Keep Women Bound To Him
content: In early 2013, Jeffrey Epstein's girlfriend, Karyna Shuliak, was stressed about her US visa status. Later that year, she married an American citizen and her worries were gone.

title: Air India's 'No-Sue' Settlement Terms For Crash Victims' Families Explained
content: The waiver also extends to each entity's "parent companies, affiliates, shareholders, officers, subsidiaries, group companies, sister concerns, directors, employees, servants, agents, reinsurers, insurers."

title: Fresh Bomb Scare On Dibrugarh-Kolkata Flight Hours After Hoax Threat
content: Hours after a Shillong-bound IndiGo flight was grounded at the city airport following a bomb threat that later turned out to be a hoax, a fresh security scare was reported on a Dibrugarh-Kolkata flight on Saturday evening.

title: Girl, 5, with Cerebral Palsy Stopped From Using Swing In Delhi Park: Family
content: Five-year-old Inika Sharma, who has cerebral palsy, wanted nothing more than to enjoy the playground swing like any other child during a weekend visit to Delhi's Sunder Nursery, a restored heritage park in Nizamuddin.

title: Devendra Fadnavis Orders Thorough Probe Into Mumbai Metro Rail Slab Collapse
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said a thorough probe will be conducted into the metro rail slab collapse incident in Mulund in Mumbai on Saturday, which killed one person and left three others injured.

title: Meta to cut pay outs to fact-checking partners in India
content: Two people with knowledge of discussions with the social media company told The Hindu that the firm planned to cut payments to professional fact checkers it has paid since 2016 by a third to half

title: Chief Minister Stalin inspects ongoing work on sports complex in Tirupattur
content: The new complex will have a spectator‚Äôs gallery with a seating capacity of over 3,500 to watch football games and athletic events

title: Love and its newfangled terms
content: Married couples in India are, reportedly, increasingly opening themselves up to alternative relationship models and structures, often in pursuit of authentic happiness and trust. Perceived for long as conservative, it seems Tamil Nadu is not entirely so. Some of the cities are now accommodating ethical non-monogamy ‚Äî very simply, a relationship involving many and with consent. Preeti M.S.¬†syncs up with married couples in Tamil Nadu to explore these new trends

title: Found in translation
content: As Parliament adds interpreters in over 20 Indian languages, the small group of people who translate speeches and other proceedings simultaneously as business unfolds in the two houses tell Aroon Deep about the emerging field

title: West Bengal BJP leadership reaches out to Muslims, says Trinamool has done nothing for minorities
content: The remarks by WB BJP president Samik Bhattacharya, which come ahead of the Assembly polls in the State, marks a significant departure from the earlier stand of the saffron party where it did not engage with minorities.

content: What are the areas that have come under scrutiny? Has India stopped buying Russian oil as Donald Trump has claimed? What is happening in the agricultural sector? Has the reference to pulses been removed from the draft? When is the formal agreement expected to be signed?

content: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan cites various statistics to argue that the education system in West Bengal had deteriorated during the Trinamool Congress regime. West Bengal Education Minister Bratya Basu refuted all the allegations

title: State level wrestling tournament begins in Bihar
content: Commonwealth Games gold medallist shooter and sports minister Shreyasi Singh asserted that the dream and goal is to ensure the participation of as many players from Bihar as possible in the Olympics in the future.

title: After couple found dead in Noida, man's family alleges murder, caste-based threats by woman's kin
content: The couple allegedly received taunts from the woman's family, and the man's family had received threats, including calls from international numbers warning of police action

title: 3,058 voters to be removed from final voter rolls in Ernakulam as SIR hearing comes to a close
content: Exclusions include deceased voters, those who have permanently shifted from the district, and persons who have relinquished Indian citizenship

content: Final roll will be published on February 21 as per the schedule published by the Election Commission of India

title: ISRO could relaunch PSLV by June or July: Jitendra Singh
content: Gaganyaan, ISRO‚Äôs first crewed space mission, was slated for 2027 and would proceed as scheduled, he says

content: A team from the National Highways Authority of India, which is in charge of the Satellite Town Ring Road, inspected the accident spot on Saturday

title: Supreme Court to hear Sabarimala review pleas on February 16
content: In November 2019, a majority judgment by a five-judge Constitution Bench led by the then Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi had referred the Sabarimala review and writ petitions to a seven-judge Bench

content: The number of coaches on the trains‚ÄîPalakkad‚ÄìErnakulam‚ÄìPalakkad, Kollam‚ÄìErnakulam‚ÄìKollam, and Kollam‚ÄìKottayam‚ÄìKollam‚Äîhas been increased from eight to twelve, Mr. Gopi said.

title: 94.5% kids survive after cancer treatment: Study
content: Anuja Jaiswal is a Senior Assistant Editor at The Times of India, with an impressive 18-year career in narrative journalism. She specializes in health and heritage reporting, expertly simplifying complex health information to make it engaging and understandable for readers. Her deep dives into heritage topics are well-researched, resulting in captivating narratives that resonate with her audience. Over the years, she has worked in Chandigarh, Chhattisgarh and West UP, gaining diverse on-ground experience that shapes her storytelling. Read More

title: Pakistan drone-dropped drugs worth Rs 40 crore seized in Jammu
content: heroin worth Rs 40 crore was seized near the international border in RS Pura . the contraband was wrapped in yellow polythene packets, the official said . local cops received information about the suspected drone movement late Friday night . it came a day after cops in Kathua, 85km away, arrested two people .

title: Debutant PDP MLA who won Omar's seat says J&K Assembly still powerful
content: pDP's Aga Syed Muntazir won the Budgam assembly seat vacated by Omar Abdullah in the Nov 2025 bypoll . he said his first experience in the Assembly has been positive and that the House remains a powerful institution even though its powers were curtailed after abrogation of Article 370 .

title: Govt cheating cotton farmers, textile exporters in US trade deal, says Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress minister Rahul Gandhi accused the govt of cheating cotton farmers and textile exporters in the country through the India-US trade deal . he alleged that the agreement is likely to inflict deep damage on both sectors .

title: EC asks West Bengal govt to comply with its directives by February 17
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‚Äòprime‚Äô political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. title: Consumer forums can‚Äôt be sinecures for retired judges: SC

title: AI investments may top $200 billion, $90 billion already pledged: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: union information technology minister Ashwini Vaishnaw says investments in the infrastructure layer of artificial intelligence may top $200 billion . he says the industry has invested in creating new tools and reskilling their workforce, so they can provide AI services .

title: Class 12 student, Arts graduate perform C-sec, woman dies
content: a class 12 student and an arts graduate allegedly performed a caesarean surgery at an unregistered private hospital, resulting in the death of a woman during childbirth . the accused were identified as Yogesh Verma (32), a BA graduate from malipur, and Shubham Vishwakarma (19), an intermediate student from Sultanpur .

title: ‚ÄòFirmly wedded to strategic autonomy‚Äô: Jaishankar on Russia energy ties
content: external affairs minister says India remains firmly committed to strategic autonomy . he was responding to a question at the Munich security conference on a recent trade agreement with the us would affect energy ties with the u.s. if India was finding it difficult to exercise its strategic autonomy in current circumstances .

title: No annual Rera reports in 75% of states: Forum
content: more than 75% of state real estate regulators, Reras, have either never published annual reports, discontinued their publication or not updated them despite statutory obligation and directions from the housing and urban affairs ministry . FPCE said annual report data is crucial for homebuyers to assess system credibility .

title: Two games, two wins: Grades, big questions after Team USA's dramatic win over Denmark
content: the game was much more dramatic than many had predicted, but the result was a 6-3 win for the united states over Denmark . team USA trailed 2-1 after the first period, before roaring back to score three in the second . the netminder allowed three goals on just 12 shots, one being a center-ice strike by rugged Danish league defender Nick Jensen .

title: USA defeats Denmark 6-3: Top moments from Olympic men's hockey
content: Emily Kaplan talks with Noah Hanifin, Matt Boldy and Jake Guentzel following the U.S men's hockey team's 6-3 win over Denmark. (0:54) After a commanding  5-1 win  over Latvia, the United States men's hockey team was back in action for Game 2 of the preliminary round in the 2026 Olympics. Saturday's game was against Denmark, which lost 3-1 to Germany in its first game. The United States won, 6-3. The U.S. now sits atop Group C, with six points. The top team from each group gets a bye into the quarterfinal round of the tournament, which begins Wednesday. Center  Brock Nelson  led the U.S. in scoring after one game, with two goals, while forwards  Jack Eichel ,  Jack Hughes ,  Matthew Tkachuk  and defenseman  Quinn Hughes  all had two assists. Forwards  Auston Matthews ,  Tage Thompson  and  Brady Tkachuk  were the other goal scorers in the opening contest. More:  Men's hockey megapreview  |  Lapsed fan's guide  |  Player rankings

title: Kyle Tucker's Dodgers contract: Final blow for labor peace?

title: How UCLA's softball star decided to join the basketball program
content: MEGAN GRANT has a career .727 slugging percentage, .978 fielding percentage and earned the Big Ten single-season record for home runs with 26 in 2025 . the senior softball star will have weight training, class and softball practice before putting on her jersey .

title: Way-Too-Early All-America team: Forecasting college football's top players in 2026
content: the Longhorns finished 10-3 last season and missed the college football Playoff . the 2026 Way-Too-Early All-America team is a tough position to pick just one player . quarterback arch Manning, receiver Cam Coleman and linebackers Colin Simmons and Rasheem Biles are on the team .

title: 11 draft prospects with a true first-round grade
content: the average draft class has roughly 15 players who are deemed "first-round talents" a player would have been a first-rounder in each of the past five classes . the 2026 class actually has fewer players at the moment .

title: Wemby vows to set competitive tone at ASG
content: the new All-Star Game format is expected to bring more intensity . wembanyama hopes to tap into the competitive spirit by breaking up the participants into two teams of americans and players from around the world . "if you share that energy, people feel like they have a responsibility to share it back to you," he says .
